DOC.brief_summary: This double-blind prospective randomize control trial . The primary hypothesis preservation motor function superior distal forearm block compare supraclavicular block . The secondary outcome include patient satisfaction , surgeon 's satisfaction , rate block success , onset duration block .
DOC.brief_title: DBRCT Effect Grip Strength Brachial Plexus v Distal Forearm Nerve Blocks
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : 1 . American Society Anesthesiologists physical status I III 2 . Aged 18 3 . Able provide consent 4 . Elective ambulatory surgery hand expect surgical time le 15 minute normally perform peripheral nerve block cover median ulnar nerve distribution intravenous sedation without general anesthesia Exclusion criterion : 1 ) Surgery outside median ulnar nerve distribution hand 2 ) Bilateral surgery 3 ) body mass index 45 kg/m2 ( high chance failure ) 4 ) neck clavicle deformities 5 ) infection injection site 6 ) exist neurologic disease 7 ) insulin dependent diabetes 8 ) Diabetes peripheral neuropathy end organ damage 9 ) allergy LA agents 10 ) coagulopathy 11 ) Past surgery upper limb 12 ) Any contraindication supraclavicular block forearm block 13 ) Contraindication monitor anesthesia care peripheral nerve block mode anesthesia .
